---
title: Platysma muscle
---

the platysma is the most superficial mm in cervical region.
The platysma covers the pec and deltoid and extends to inferior margin of body of mandible.
It functions as one of the muscles of facial expression and can restrain head extension.

![Nerves of the scalp and side of the neck @grayAnatomyHumanBody1918](/The Archive/Images/Gray anatomy 1918 images/Neurology/image790 The nerves of the scalp face and side of neck.gif)



# Anatomy
## Overview
## Origin {#origin}
Skin over lower neck and upper lateral thorax @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020

## Insertion {#insertion}
[Mandible (inf border)]({{< var ref-mandible-bone.path >}}), Skin over lower face, Angle of mouth @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020

## Variations

The above information is the *usual* presentation of the platysma, but there are many anatomical variations.

- A hybrid muscle that is the combination of the SCM and [platysma]({{< var ref-platysma.path >}}) @donnellyTravellSimonsSimons2019


# Innervation {#innervation}

[Facial Nerve CN VII]({{< var ref-cn7.path >}}) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020

# Action {#action}
Depresses and wrinkles skin of lower face and mouth; Tenses skin of neck; Aids in forced depression of the mandible @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020
